1.label: immediate fire
1.description: Crisis situation requiring immediate action within days or weeks

2.label: this quarter
2.description: Urgent priority that must be addressed within the current quarter

3.label: this fiscal year
3.description: Important initiative planned for completion within the fiscal year

4.label: multi-year
4.description: Strategic initiative with timeline spanning multiple years

1.label: weeks
1.description: Results visible within weeks of deployment

2.label: quarter
2.description: Impact measurable within a quarter after implementation

3.label: long-cycle
3.description: Benefits accrue over extended periods, multiple quarters or years

1.label: fast payback
1.description: Investment recovers within 6-12 months

2.label: medium
2.description: ROI expected within 1-2 years

3.label: strategic
3.description: Long-term value creation, 3+ years to full ROI

1.label: team
1.description: Limited to a single team or small group

2.label: function
2.description: Spans an entire functional department (e.g., Sales, Marketing)

3.label: business unit
3.description: Affects an entire business unit or division

1.label: pilot only
1.description: Designed as standalone experiment with no scaling plans

2.label: scale within function
2.description: Can expand to other teams within the same function

3.label: org-wide
3.description: Platform or capability that can scale across the entire organization

1.label: supporting
1.description: Nice-to-have process that supports but doesn't directly drive business outcomes

2.label: core
2.description: Important business process that significantly impacts operations

3.label: mission-critical
3.description: Essential process where failure would severely impact business continuity

1.label: individual contributor
1.description: Sponsored by an IC or team lead

2.label: manager
2.description: Sponsored by middle management

3.label: VP
3.description: Sponsored by VP-level executive

1.label: solo owner
1.description: Single decision-maker can approve and proceed

2.label: small coalition
2.description: Requires alignment among 2-5 key stakeholders

3.label: broad consensus
3.description: Needs buy-in from many stakeholders across functions

1.label: low
1.description: Minimal political navigation needed

2.label: medium
2.description: Some stakeholder management and negotiation required

3.label: high
3.description: Significant political capital and relationship management essential

1.label: quiet win
1.description: Keep low profile, prove value before broadcasting

2.label: internal showcase
2.description: Share success internally to build momentum

3.label: public case study
3.description: Promote externally as thought leadership and brand building

1.label: technical only
1.description: Story resonates with technical teams but lacks business narrative

2.label: department-ready
2.description: Clear business value story for functional leaders

3.label: board-friendly
3.description: Compelling strategic narrative suitable for executive and board communication

1.label: OKR fit
1.description: Aligns with current OKRs and priorities

2.label: must-win theme
2.description: Core to strategic must-win battles

3.label: distraction
3.description: Potentially diverts focus from strategic priorities

1.label: parity
1.description: Maintains competitive parity with market standards

2.label: catch-up
2.description: Closes gap with competitors who are ahead

3.label: leapfrog
3.description: Opportunity to surpass competitors significantly

1.label: locks in
1.description: Creates vendor lock-in or reduces future flexibility

2.label: neutral
2.description: Neither constrains nor expands future options

3.label: opens paths
3.description: Enables new capabilities and strategic options

1.label: none
1.description: No risk to existing revenue streams or products

2.label: partial
2.description: May impact some existing offerings

3.label: material
3.description: Significant risk of cannibalizing current business

1.label: internal
1.description: Impacts internal operations only

2.label: customer-facing
2.description: Visible to customers, affects brand perception

3.label: PR-ready
3.description: Strong external PR and thought leadership opportunity

1.label: indirect
1.description: Indirect or unclear connection to revenue

2.label: retention
2.description: Improves customer retention and reduces churn

3.label: cross-sell
3.description: Enables cross-sell and upsell opportunities

1.label: opex reduction
1.description: Reduces ongoing operational expenses

2.label: capex avoidance
2.description: Avoids or defers capital expenditures

3.label: vendor spend cut
3.description: Reduces third-party vendor costs

1.label: opex
1.description: Funded from operational budget

2.label: capex
2.description: Requires capital investment approval

3.label: pilot fund
3.description: Funded from dedicated pilot/experimentation budget

4.label: innovation grant
4.description: Funded through innovation or transformation program

1.label: OKR
1.description: Funded as part of OKR-driven initiatives

2.label: savings commitment
2.description: Funded based on committed cost savings

3.label: executive mandate
3.description: Funded by executive directive or strategic imperative

1.label: none
1.description: No compliance requirements or regulatory pressure

2.label: pending
2.description: Upcoming regulations or compliance requirements

3.label: active audit/regulation
3.description: Under active audit or regulatory scrutiny

1.label: none
1.description: No specific regulatory domain applies

2.label: GDPR
2.description: Subject to GDPR data protection requirements

3.label: AI Act
3.description: Subject to EU AI Act or similar AI-specific regulations

4.label: sector-specific
4.description: Subject to industry-specific regulations (e.g., HIPAA, SOX, financial services)

1.label: low
1.description: Minimal legal risk

2.label: reputational
2.description: Risk of reputational damage or PR issues

3.label: contractual
3.description: Risk of breaching contracts or SLAs

4.label: regulatory
4.description: Risk of regulatory fines or legal action

1.label: assistive only
1.description: AI provides suggestions, humans make all decisions

2.label: semi-autonomous
2.description: AI makes some decisions with human oversight

3.label: autonomous
3.description: AI operates autonomously with minimal human intervention

1.label: easy rollback
1.description: Can quickly revert to previous state if needed

2.label: moderate
2.description: Rollback possible but requires effort and coordination

3.label: hard to unwind
3.description: Difficult or impossible to reverse once implemented

1.label: monitoring only
1.description: Basic monitoring in place

2.label: rollback playbook
2.description: Documented incident response and rollback procedures

3.label: auditable end-to-end
3.description: Full audit trail and comprehensive incident management

1.label: none
1.description: No union or works council involvement required

2.label: consult
2.description: Requires consultation with union or works council

3.label: negotiate
3.description: Requires formal negotiation and agreement with labor representatives

1.label: availability
1.description: Data exists but may have quality or access issues

2.label: quality
2.description: Data is available and of sufficient quality

3.label: lineage
3.description: Data quality is good with documented lineage

4.label: access
4.description: High-quality data with clear lineage and easy access

1.label: public
1.description: Public data with no sensitivity

2.label: internal
2.description: Internal data not for public disclosure

3.label: confidential
3.description: Confidential business data requiring protection

4.label: PII
4.description: Personally identifiable information requiring strict controls

5.label: PCI
5.description: Payment card data requiring PCI-DSS compliance

1.label: vendor cloud
1.description: Can use third-party cloud services

2.label: anonymized
2.description: Requires data anonymization before external processing

3.label: VPC
3.description: Must remain in private cloud environment

4.label: on-prem
4.description: Must remain on-premises, no cloud processing

1.label: none
1.description: No data residency requirements

2.label: EU-only
2.description: Data must remain within EU jurisdiction

3.label: country-specific
3.description: Data must remain within specific country borders

1.label: policies drafted
1.description: Governance policies exist in draft form

2.label: approvals defined
2.description: Clear approval processes and governance structure in place

3.label: auditable
3.description: Fully auditable governance with documented compliance

1.label: buy
1.description: Purchase off-the-shelf solution

2.label: extend
2.description: Extend existing platform or tool

3.label: hybrid
3.description: Combination of purchased and custom-built components

1.label: single vendor
1.description: Relies on single vendor solution

2.label: multi-vendor
2.description: Uses multiple vendor solutions with integration

3.label: in-house
3.description: Primarily in-house development with minimal vendor dependency

1.label: existing stack
1.description: Fits within current technology stack

2.label: minor gaps
2.description: Requires some new tools but mostly compatible

3.label: major new stack
3.description: Requires significant new technology stack

1.label: surface API
1.description: Simple API integration, minimal coupling

2.label: system-of-record
2.description: Deep integration with system of record

3.label: bi-directional
3.description: Complex bi-directional data synchronization

1.label: few dependencies
1.description: Minimal dependencies on other systems or teams

2.label: cross-team
2.description: Requires coordination across multiple teams

3.label: ecosystem
3.description: Complex ecosystem with many interdependencies

1.label: simple orchestration
1.description: Basic workflow orchestration or API calls

2.label: multi-agent
2.description: Multi-agent systems or complex orchestration

3.label: advanced ML
3.description: Advanced ML models, training pipelines, or custom algorithms

1.label: batch
1.description: Batch processing acceptable, results can wait hours or days

2.label: near-real-time
2.description: Results needed within seconds to minutes

3.label: real-time
3.description: Sub-second response time required

1.label: approximate OK
1.description: Approximate results acceptable, errors tolerated

2.label: calibrated
2.description: Needs calibrated confidence scores and reasonable accuracy

3.label: high-precision
3.description: High precision required, minimal error tolerance

1.label: light training
1.description: Minimal change, basic training sufficient

2.label: process redesign
2.description: Requires significant process changes and retraining

3.label: role redesign
3.description: Fundamental role changes, potential job redesign or displacement

1.label: business-led
1.description: Business team owns and operates

2.label: tech-led
2.description: Technology team owns and operates

3.label: joint
3.description: Shared ownership between business and technology

1.label: upskill
1.description: Train existing team members

2.label: reassign
2.description: Reassign internal talent from other areas

3.label: hire
3.description: Hire new specialized talent

4.label: outsource
4.description: Outsource to external partners or consultants

1.label: team can own
1.description: Team can support independently

2.label: needs Center of Excellence
2.description: Requires centralized CoE support

3.label: needs vendor
3.description: Requires ongoing vendor support and maintenance

1.label: shadow test
1.description: Can run in shadow mode without impacting operations

2.label: pilot in prod
2.description: Limited production deployment with fallback options

3.label: cutover
3.description: Hard cutover with operational continuity risk

1.label: review-on-fail
1.description: Human review only when system flags issues

2.label: spot-check
2.description: Periodic sampling and quality checks

3.label: continuous human-in-the-loop
3.description: Continuous human review of all outputs

1.label: SLA
1.description: Impacts service level agreements and uptime

2.label: NPS
2.description: Affects Net Promoter Score or customer satisfaction

3.label: cycle time
3.description: Reduces process cycle time or time-to-value

4.label: error rate
4.description: Reduces error rates or defect rates

5.label: margin
5.description: Directly impacts profit margins or unit economics

1.label: none
1.description: No baseline metrics available

2.label: partial baseline
2.description: Some baseline data exists but incomplete

3.label: clear baseline
3.description: Clear baseline metrics with good data quality

1.label: simple metrics
1.description: Simple quantitative metrics (accuracy, latency, etc.)

2.label: task evals
2.description: Requires task-specific evaluation frameworks

3.label: human-in-the-loop
3.description: Requires human judgment for quality assessment

1.label: one-off
1.description: Unique solution, not reusable

2.label: templateable
2.description: Can be templated for similar use cases

3.label: platformable
3.description: Can become reusable platform capability

1.label: single case
1.description: Solves single specific problem only

2.label: many functions
2.description: Applicable across multiple functions or teams

3.label: externalizable IP
3.description: Potential product or external IP opportunity

1.label: low
1.description: Minimal organizational learning value

2.label: template creation
2.description: Creates reusable templates and patterns

3.label: high lessons
3.description: High strategic learning value for future initiatives

1.label: internal only
1.description: Affects internal operations only, no customer visibility

2.label: limited external
2.description: Limited customer-facing impact or indirect effects

3.label: high-touch external
3.description: Direct high-touch customer interaction and experience

1.label: single locale
1.description: Single language and locale sufficient

2.label: multilingual
2.description: Requires multiple languages and locale support

1.label: none
1.description: No accessibility considerations required

2.label: content accessibility
2.description: Content must be accessible (WCAG compliance)

3.description: Full workflow accessibility for users with disabilities

1.label: none
1.description: No procurement process required, can proceed directly

2.label: light
2.description: Light procurement review or approval needed

3.label: RFP
3.description: Formal RFP process required with vendor evaluation

1.description: Carbon and energy impact not tracked or considered
